data.title: MLB Team Color Codes Hex, RGB, PANTONE and CMYK
data.meta_description: Here are all of the MLB Team colors along with the corresponding hex color codes. All of the NL and AL team colors are included.
data.text:
MLB Team Color Codes

What are MLB Teams and their Colors?

The MLB is a professional baseball league with 30 teams. MLB stands for Major League Baseball. MLB Team Colors in RGB, Pantone, HEX, and CMYK can be found in the respective tables below.

The MLB has 2 leagues – National League (NL) and American League (AL). 15 MLB teams play in the National League and 15 MLB teams play in the American League.

All 30 teams play in the regular season, and 12 MLB teams play in the playoffs (6 teams from each league). MLB team colors are chosen based on the MLB team’s history, character, city, and foundation culture. MLB team colors display the team’s character and the fans’ image of the MLB team.

The most recent MLB champion are the Atlanta Braves. The list of all MLB teams can be found below.

Arizona Diamondbacks

Atlanta Braves

Baltimore Orioles

Boston Red Sox

Chicago Cubs

Chicago White Sox

Cincinnati Reds

Cleveland Guardians

Colorado Rockies

Detroit Tigers

Houston Astros

Kansas City Royals

Los Angeles Angels

Los Angeles Dodgers

Miami Marlins

Milwaukee Brewers

Minnesota Twins

New York Mets

New York Yankees

Oakland Athletics

Philadelphia Phillies

Pittsburgh Pirates

San Diego Padres

San Francisco Giants

Seattle Mariners

St. Louis Cardinals

Tampa Bay Rays

Texas Rangers

Toronto Blue Jays

Washington Nationals

The colors that MLB teams use are white, blue, red, yellow (gold), black, silver (gray), orange, green, beige (sand), purple, maroon, teal, and brown.

The most popular colors for MLB teams are white, blue, and red. All 30 MLB teams use white color, 21 MLB teams use blue color, and 17 MLB teams use red color.

The least used colors of MLB teams are purple, maroon, teal, and brown. Only 1 MLB team uses brown color.

The colors that MLB teams use can be seen in the MLB Color Table below.

MLB Team Colors MLB Team Name Color 1 Color 2 Color 3 Color 4 Color 5 Arizona Diamondbacks Sedona Red Sonoran Sand Black Teal White Atlanta Braves Scarlet Navy Blue Yellow White Baltimore Orioles Orange Black White Boston Red Sox Red Blue White Chicago Cubs Blue Red White Chicago White Sox Black Silver White Cincinnati Reds Red Black White Cleveland Guardians Navy Blue Red White Colorado Rockies Rockies Purple Silver Black White Detroit Tigers Navy Blue Orange White Houston Astros Navy Blue Orange Light Orange White Kansas City Royals Royal Blue Gold White Los Angeles Angels Blue Red Maroon Silver White Los Angeles Dodgers Dodger Blue Red Silver White Miami Marlins Miami Blue Caliente Red Slate Gray Midnight Black White Milwaukee Brewers Navy Blue Yellow White Minnesota Twins Twins Navy Blue Scarlet Red Kasota Gold White New York Mets Blue Orange White New York Yankees Blue Red Navy Blue Gray White Oakland Athletics Green Gold Gray White Philadelphia Phillies Red Blue White Pittsburgh Pirates Black Yellow White San Diego Padres Brown Gold White San Francisco Giants Orange Black Beige Gold White Seattle Mariners Navy Blue Northwest Green Silver Red White St. Louis Cardinals Red Navy Blue Yellow White Tampa Bay Rays Navy Blue Columbia Blue Yellow White Texas Rangers Blue Red White Toronto Blue Jays Blue Navy Blue Red White Washington Nationals Red Navy Blue White

Contents

What Colors Do MLB Teams Use?

The colors used by the MLB teams are listed below.

White (Arizona Diamondbacks, Atlanta Braves, Baltimore Orioles, Boston Red Sox, Chicago Cubs, Chicago White Sox, Cincinnati Reds, Cleveland Guardians, Colorado Rockies, Detroit Tigers, Houston Astros, Kansas City Royals, Los Angeles Angels, Los Angeles Dodgers, Miami Marlins, Milwaukee Brewers, Minnesota Twins, New York Mets, New York Yankees, Oakland Athletics, Philadelphia Phillies, Pittsburgh Pirates, San Diego Padres, San Francisco Giants, Seattle Mariners, St. Louis Cardinals, Tampa Bay Rays, Texas Rangers, Toronto Blue Jays, Washington Nationals)

Blue (Atlanta Braves, Boston Red Sox, Chicago Cubs, Cleveland Guardians, Detroit Tigers, Houston Astros, Kansas City Royals, Los Angeles Angels, Los Angeles Dodgers, Miami Marlins, Milwaukee Brewers, Minnesota Twins, New York Mets, New York Yankees, Philadelphia Phillies, Seattle Mariners, St. Louis Cardinals, Tampa Bay Rays, Texas Rangers, Toronto Blue Jays, Washington Nationals)

Red (Arizona Diamondbacks, Boston Red Sox, Chicago Cubs, Cincinnati Reds, Cleveland Guardians, Los Angeles Angels, Los Angeles Dodgers, Miami Marlins, Minnesota Twins, New York Yankees, Philadelphia Phillies, Seattle Mariners, St. Louis Cardinals, Texas Rangers, Toronto Blue Jays, Washington Nationals)

Yellow, Gold (Atlanta Braves, Kansas City Royals, Milwaukee Brewers, Minnesota Twins, Oakland Athletics, Pittsburgh Pirates, San Diego Padres, San Francisco Giants, St. Louis Cardinals, Tampa Bay Rays)

Black (Arizona Diamondbacks, Atlanta Braves, Baltimore Orioles, Chicago White Sox, Cincinnati Reds, Colorado Rockies, Miami Marlins, Pittsburgh Pirates, San Francisco Giants)

Silver, Gray (Chicago White Sox, Colorado Rockies, Los Angeles Angels, Los Angeles Dodgers, Miami Marlins, New York Yankees, Oakland Athletics, Seattle Mariners)

Orange (Baltimore Orioles, Detroit Tigers, Houston Astros, New York Mets, San Francisco Giants)

Green (Oakland Athletics, Seattle Mariners)

Beige, Sand (Arizona Diamondbacks, San Francisco Giants)

Purple (Colorado Rockies)

Maroon (Los Angeles Angels)

Teal (Arizona Diamondbacks)

Brown (San Diego Padres)

MLB teams choose their colors based on the color significance to the team’s state, city, and history. The most used colors of MLB teams (white, blue, and red) have been chosen because they are traditional for the sport of baseball or are found on state or city flags.

What are the Meanings of the Colors Used by MLB Teams?

The meanings of MLB Team Colors are listed below.

Arizona Diamondbacks – The Arizona Diamondbacks colors (Sedona red, Sonoran sand, black, teal) pay tribute to the Sedona canyon, Sonoran desert, and the Diamondbacks team history (the recognizable teal color).

Atlanta Braves – The Atlanta Braves colors (scarlet, navy, yellow) pay tribute to the team’s rich history and represent all the main colors that the team has used in the past.

Baltimore Orioles – The Baltimore Orioles colors (orange, black) symbolize the oriole bird.

Boston Red Sox – The Boston Red Sox colors (red, white) pay tribute to the bright red socks that the players wore when the team was established.

Chicago Cubs – The exact origin of the Chicago Cubs colors (blue, red, white) is not known.

Chicago White Sox – The exact origin of the Chicago White Sox colors (black, silver, white) is not known.

Cincinnati Reds – The Cincinnati Reds colors (red, black, white) pay tribute to the team name.

Cleveland Guardians – The Cleveland Guardians colors (navy blue, red, white) pay tribute to the team’s history as well as the flag of the United States.

Colorado Rockies – The Colorado Rockies colors (Rockies purple, silver) pay tribute to the Colorado Rocky Mountains (also known as the purple mountain majesties), and the patriotic song „America the Beautiful“.

Detroit Tigers – The Detroit Tigers colors (navy, orange) pay tribute to the team’s history as well as the main color of tigers – orange.

Houston Astros – The exact origin of the Houston Astros colors (navy, orange, white) is not known.

Kansas City Royals – The Kansas City Royals colors (royal blue, gold, black, white) pay tribute to the traditional royal colors.

Los Angeles Angels – The exact origin of the Los Angeles Angels colors (blue, red, maroon, silver) is not known.

Los Angeles Dodgers – The Los Angeles Dodgers colors (Dodger blue, red) pay tribute to the team’s rich history and resemble the flag of the United States.

Miami Marlins – The Miami Marlins colors (Miami blue, Caliente red, slate gray, midnight black) pay tribute to the city of Miami, the ocean, and the sunset.

Milwaukee Brewers – The Milwaukee Brewers colors (navy blue, blue, yellow, white) are based on the colors of the Seattle Pilots (the team’s predecessor) and their home uniforms.

Minnesota Twins – The Minnesota Twins colors (Twins navy, scarlet red, gray, white) pay tribute to the team’s history.

New York Mets – The New York Mets colors (blue, orange, white) represent the official colors of the state of New York.

New York Yankees – The exact origin of the New York Yankees colors (blue, red, white) is not known.

Oakland Athletics – The Oakland Athletics colors (green, gold, white) were first introduced by the team’s old owner Charlie Finley as a way to differentiate the A’s from the traditional blue and red colors used by most teams.

Philadelphia Phillies – The exact origin of the Philadelphia Phillies colors (red, blue, white) is not known.

Pittsburgh Pirates – The Pittsburgh Pirates colors (yellow, black) pay tribute to the Pittsburgh city flag which uses the same colors.

San Diego Padres – The San Diego Padres colors (brown, yellow) were first introduced by Buzzie Bavasi, the founding club president, who wanted colors that would match the San Diego tradition and vibe.

San Francisco Giants – The San Francisco Giants colors (orange, black, beige, gold) pay tribute to the team’s rich history and draw their origin from the time the team played in New York.

Seattle Mariners – The exact origin of the Seattle Mariners colors (navy blue, Northwest green, silver, red, white) is not known.

St. Louis Cardinals – The St. Louis Cardinals colors (Cardinal red, navy, yellow) pay tribute to the cardinal bird.

Tampa Bay Rays – The Tampa Bay Rays colors (navy blue, Columbia blue, yellow, white) symbolize rays, blue skies, and the sunny weather of Florida.

Texas Rangers – The Texas Rangers colors (blue, red, white) pay tribute to the state flag of Texas.

Toronto Blue Jays – The Toronto Blue Jays colors (blue, navy blue, red, white) pay tribute to the blue jay bird.

Washington Nationals – The exact origin of the Washington Nationals colors (red, navy blue, white) is not known.

RGB Color Codes of MLB Teams can be found in the MLB RGB Color Codes Table below.

What Do MLB Teams’ Logos Mean?

The meaning of the MLB team logos can be found below.

Arizona Diamondbacks – The Arizona Diamondbacks logo symbolizes a letter A (Arizona initial) with diamond shapes on its side that pay tribute to the diamondback rattlesnake.

Atlanta Braves – The Atlanta Braves logo symbolizes a tomahawk that pays tribute to Native Americans.

Baltimore Orioles – The Baltimore Orioles logo symbolizes an oriole bird which is the inspiration for the team name.

Boston Red Sox – The Boston Red Sox logo symbolizes a pair of red socks which are the inspiration for the team name.

Chicago Cubs – The Chicago Cubs logo symbolizes the stylized team name (Cubs) in a white circle with a thick blue outline.

Chicago White Sox – The Chicago White Sox logo symbolizes a stylized monogram that represents the team name (Sox).

Cincinnati Reds – The Cincinnati Reds logo symbolizes a wishbone C that pays tribute to Cincinnati as well as the team name (Reds) written inside it.

Cleveland Guardians – The Cleveland Guardians logo symbolizes a winged baseball with capital letter Gs on its sides that represent the Guardians name initial.

Colorado Rockies – The Colorado Rockies logo symbolizes a monogram consisting of the Colorado Rockies name initials (C and R).

Detroit Tigers – The Detroit Tigers logo symbolizes an old English letter D that pays tribute to the team’s long history.

Houston Astros – The Houston Astros logo symbolizes the initial of the team’s home city (Houston) placed on a star that pays tribute to the city flag.

Kansas City Royals – The Kansas City Royals logo symbolizes a shield and a crown which are traditional royal symbols.

Los Angeles Angels – The Los Angeles Angels logo symbolizes the Angels team initial (letter A) with a halo around the top of the letter.

Los Angeles Dodgers – The Los Angeles Dodgers logo symbolizes the team name with a flying baseball behind it.

Miami Marlins – The Miami Marlins logo symbolizes the marlin fish which inspired the team name.

Milwaukee Brewers – The Milwaukee Brewers logo symbolizes a baseball glove with lowercase letters „b“ and „m“ incorporated in it, representing Brewers and Milwaukee.

Minnesota Twins – The Minnesota Twins logo symbolizes the team name and the sport it competes in.

New York Mets – The New York Mets logo symbolizes the skyline of the city of New York, the team’s name, and the sport it competes in.

New York Yankees – The New York Yankees logo symbolizes the team name, a baseball and bat, and a top hat with colors inspired by the United States flag.

Oakland Athletics – The Oakland Athletics logo symbolizes the Athletics team initial (capital letter A).

Philadelphia Phillies – The Philadelphia Phillies logo symbolizes the Liberty Bell, a symbol of Philadelphia and American independence.

Pittsburgh Pirates – The Pittsburgh Pirates logo symbolizes the Pirates team initial (capital letter P).

San Diego Padres – The San Diego Padres logo symbolizes a monogram consisting of San Diego city initials (S and D).

San Francisco Giants – The San Francisco Giants logo symbolizes the Giants team name as well as baseball, the sport that the team competes in.

Seattle Mariners – The Seattle Mariners logo symbolizes a baseball and a compass which is a well-known instrument used by mariners (sailors).

St. Louis Cardinals – The St. Louis Cardinals logo symbolizes a red cardinal bird which inspired the team name, standing on a bat which represents the sport of baseball.

Tampa Bay Rays – The Tampa Bay Rays logo symbolizes the team name with the letter R stylized to resemble the tail fin of a stingray.

Texas Rangers – The Texas Rangers logo symbolizes the state’s initial (capital letter T) on a baseball.

Toronto Blue Jays – The Toronto Blue Jays logo symbolizes the head of a blue jay which inspired the team name, as well as a red maple leaf, the symbol of Canada.

Washington Nationals – The Washington Nationals logo symbolizes Washington D.C., the home city of the team (capital letter W).

How are the Logos Of the MLB Teams Drawn?

To draw the MLB Teams’ logos, one can use GraphicSprings (free), Canva (great value), or Adobe Illustrator (best overall). To draw the MLB Team logos, the MLB Team colors should be analyzed with a color picker. Before drawing the MLB team’s logo, the font of the logo should be analyzed just like the MLB team logo colors. The steps of drawing the MLB Team logo are listed below.

Use the color picker to detect the MLB team color code.

Check if the MLB Team color code is correct on TeamColorCodes.com.

Check the MLB team logo’s font options.

Understand the style, objects, and colors of the MLB team logo.

Pick the MLB team logo drawing method (online or offline).

Draw the MLB team logo based on the color, object, and font information, then compare it to the original MLB team logo.

What Colors Do MLB Teams Use in Their Logos?

The colors that MLB Teams use in their logos are listed below.

Arizona Diamondbacks – The Arizona Diamondbacks logo uses Sedona red, Sonoran sand, and black colors.

Atlanta Braves – The Atlanta Braves logo uses scarlet, navy, and yellow colors.

Baltimore Orioles – The Baltimore Orioles logo uses orange, black, and white colors.

Boston Red Sox – The Boston Red Sox logo uses red and white colors.

Chicago Cubs – The Chicago Cubs logo uses blue, red, and white colors.

Chicago White Sox – The Chicago White Sox logo uses black, silver, and white colors.

Cincinnati Reds – The Cincinnati Reds logo uses red, black, and white colors.

Cleveland Guardians – The Cleveland Guardians logo uses navy blue, red, and white colors.

Colorado Rockies – The Colorado Rockies logo uses Rockies purple and silver colors.

Detroit Tigers – The Detroit Tigers logo uses navy blue color.

Houston Astros – The Houston Astros logo uses navy, orange, light orange, and white colors.

Kansas City Royals – The Kansas City Royals logo uses Royal blue, gold, black, and white colors.

Los Angeles Angels – The Los Angeles Angels logo uses blue, red, maroon, and silver colors.

Los Angeles Dodgers – The Los Angeles Dodgers logo uses Dodger blue and red colors.

Miami Marlins – The Miami Marlins logo uses Miami blue, Caliente red, slate gray, and midnight black colors.

Milwaukee Brewers – The Milwaukee Brewers logo uses Navy blue, blue, yellow, and white colors.

Minnesota Twins – The Minnesota Twins logo uses Twins navy, scarlet red, gray, and white colors.

New York Mets – The New York Mets logo uses blue, orange, and white colors.

New York Yankees – The New York Yankees logo uses blue, red, and white colors.

Oakland Athletics – The Oakland Athletics logo uses green, gold, and white colors.

Philadelphia Phillies – The Philadelphia Phillies logo uses red, blue, and white colors.

Pittsburgh Pirates – The Pittsburgh Pirates logo uses yellow color.

San Diego Padres – The San Diego Padres logo uses brown color.

San Francisco Giants – The San Francisco Giants logo uses orange, black, beige, gold, and white colors.

Seattle Mariners – The Seattle Mariners logo uses navy blue, Northwest green, silver, red and white colors.

St. Louis Cardinals – The St. Louis Cardinals logo uses Cardinal red, navy, and yellow colors.

Tampa Bay Rays – The Tampa Bay Rays logo uses navy blue, Columbia blue, yellow, and white colors.

Texas Rangers – The Texas Rangers logo uses blue, red, and white colors.
